get.description: Return your own profile information. To make changes to your profile, run the [Edit your profile](ref:put-user-profile-info) operation.

parameters.description: Includes the list of your group and role assignments, `false` by default.
parameters.name: authGrants

parameters.description: Includes product notifications you subscribe to, `false` by default.
parameters.name: notifications

parameters.description: Includes information about actions such as `edit` or `delete` that you can take for the object, `false` by default. Don't confuse this with the `action` parameter, which applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.
parameters.name: actions

authGrants.roleDescription: This is a new role that has been created to

accountId.description: A unique identifier for each account.

actions.description: Encapsulates permissions available to the user for this group. This data is available when you specify the `actions` parameter of the same name, not to be confused with the `action` parameter that applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

apiClient.description: Allows the administrator to create an API client.

delete.description: Indicates whether the user is deletable.

edit.description: Indicates whether the user is editable.

isCloneable.description: If `true`, an administrator can create a new user with the same permissions as this user.

resetPassword.description: Allows an administrator to send a user a password by email or see a one-time token.

thirdPartyAccess.description: Allows the administrator to manage extended access.

authGrants.description: A user's role assignments, per group. If you provide this member in a POST request, don't include the `cloneFrom` member in the request too.

items.description: A user's role assignments, per group. If you provide this member in a POST request, don't include the `cloneFrom` member in the request too.

groupId.description: A unique identifier for each group.

isBlocked.description: Indicates whether a user's access is blocked for a group.

roleId.description: A unique identifier for each role.

subGroups.description: Children of the parent group, represented as an array of groups. Permissions cascade downward from parent to child unless the child group's `isBlocked` is `true`.

contactType.description: To help characterize the user, the value can be any that are available from the [View contact types](ref:get-common-contact-types) operation.

country.description: Part of the user's location. This can be any value available from the [View supported countries](ref:get-common-countries) operation.

lastLoginDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp indicating when the user last logged in.

mobilePhone.description: The user's mobile phone number, represented as a 10-digit integer within a string.

notifications.description: The notification emails the user receives for products.

enableEmailNotifications.description: Indicates if email notifications are enabled.

options.description: The types of notification emails the user receives.

newUserNotification.description: Send emails to group administrators when new users are created.

proactive.description: Lists products for which the user receives notification emails about service issues.

upgrade.description: Lists products for which the user receives notification emails about upgrades.

passwordExpiryDate.description: The date a user's password expires.

phone.description: The user's main phone number, represented as a ten-digit integer within a string.

preferredLanguage.description: The value can be any that are available from the [View languages](ref:get-common-languages) operation.

sessionTimeOut.description: The number of seconds it takes for the user's Control Center session to time out if there hasn't been any activity. This corresponds to the `value` output of the [View timeout policies](ref:get-common-timeout-policies) operation.

timeZone.description: The user's time zone. The value can be any that are available from the [View time zones](ref:get-common-timezones) operation.

uiIdentityId.description: A unique identifier for a user's profile, which corresponds to a user's actual profile or client ID.

uiUserName.description: A user's `loginId`. Typically, a user's email address.

zipCode.description: The user's five-digit ZIP code, represented as a string.

put.description: Update your basic profile information. You can update simple items like your name or phone number, but you can't update your group or role assignments through this operation.

contactType.description: Any of the values available from the [View contact types](ref:get-common-contact-types) operation.

country.description: Part of the user's location. This can be any value available from the [View supported countries](ref:get-common-countries) operation.

mobilePhone.description: The user's mobile phone number, represented as a 10-digit integer within a string.

phone.description: The user's main phone number, represented as a ten-digit integer within a string.

preferredLanguage.description: Any of the values available from the [View languages](ref:get-common-languages) operation.

sessionTimeOut.description: The number of seconds it takes for the user's Control Center session to time out if there hasn't been any activity. This corresponds to the `value` output of the [View timeout policies](ref:get-common-timeout-policies) operation.

state.description: The user's state if `country=USA`, or the user's province if `country=Canada`. For all other countries, this field is optional.

tfaEnabled.description: Indicates whether two-factor authentication is enabled.

timeZone.description: The user's time zone. The value can be any that are available from the [View time zones](ref:get-common-timezones) operation.

zipCode.description: The user's five-digit ZIP code, represented as a string.

accountId.description: A unique identifier for each account.

actions.description: Encapsulates permissions available to the user for this group. This data is available when you specify the `actions` parameter of the same name, not to be confused with the `action` parameter that applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.

200.description: The response returns the updated profile.

post.description: To update or change your password, include your old password and your new password in the request body. Run the [View password policy](ref:get-common-password-policy) operation before you create your new password to ensure it adheres to your policy. If you pass your existing password incorrectly and make too many login attempts, your account locks.

schema.description: Uses the old password to authenticate you are who you say you are when you update your password. Includes the new password.

put.description: Subscribe to notifications emails for password expiration reminders, proactive maintenance emails, and upgrade notification emails. Make a PUT request with a notification object.

schema.description: Encapsulates the types of email notifications you can receive.

options.description: Specific notification types users can subscribe to.

newUserNotification.description: If `true`, send emails to group admins. This notification informs the admin a new user was created and granted access to their group.

proactive.description: A list of products subscribed to for proactive notification emails.

upgrade.description: A list of products subscribed to for upgrade notification emails.

schema.description: Encapsulates the types of email notifications you can receive.

enableEmailNotifications.description: Indicates if email notifications are enabled.

options.description: Specific notification types users can subscribe to.

newUserNotification.description: Send emails to group admins regarding new user creation.

proactive.description: A list of products subscribed to for proactive notification emails.

upgrade.description: A list of products subscribed to for upgrade notification emails.

put.description: Enable or disable TFA on your profile. An account administrator needs to disable TFA for you if the account is set to `enable`. If the account doesn't specify a TFA setting, you can `disable` TFA on your profile yourself. You can always set TFA to `enable` regardless of account-level settings. If you have TFA enabled, `reset` TFA clears your TFA settings and you'll be asked to set up TFA the next time you log in to Control Center.

parameters.description: Includes the actions you can perform for TFA on your own profile, either `enable`, `disable`, or `reset`. Don't confuse this with the `actions` parameter, which applies to the various operations that get user data.
parameters.name: action

authGrants-query.description: Includes the list of your group and role assignments, `false` by default.
authGrants-query.name: authGrants

notifications-query.description: Includes product notifications you subscribe to, `false` by default.
notifications-query.name: notifications

QParamsActions_actions.description: Includes information about actions such as `edit` or `delete` that you can take for the object, `false` by default. Don't confuse this with the `action` parameter, which applies to the [Set two-factor authentication](ref:put-user-profile-tfa) operation.
QParamsActions_actions.name: actions

action-query.description: Includes the actions you can perform for TFA on your own profile, either `enable`, `disable`, or `reset`. Don't confuse this with the `actions` parameter, which applies to the various operations that get user data.
action-query.name: action
